result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip Robert Desoto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Phillip Robert Desoto is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Phillip Robert Desoto was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Phillip Robert Desoto was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
- Report to probation August 2, 2022. Probation may be transferred to MN. 
- 3 days credit in the event of revocation. 

- In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 3 in 22CF199

miscConds.notes:
- $200 DNA Surcharge payable through Clerk of Court. 
- $243 Court costs payable through Clerk of Court.
- $100 Domestic abuse surcharge payable through Clerk of Court. 
Payment plan approved to begin September 1, 2022

- DNA Sample
- Absolute Sobriety 
- No contact with C. Thompson except through text for child related matters only.
- Participate in a domestic violence evaluation and complete follow through. 
- Random testing 
- Complete and comply with AODA treatment plan

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip Robert Desoto

records.addlTxt: e: Atty Shane, State and DOC. c: def and SCSO. sf

filed by Atty Shane. sf
signed by Def. sf

9:18 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Phillip Robert Desoto in court.  Attorney Robert James Shane in court for Phillip Robert Desoto. There is an agreement. ADA Ellenwood recites. Victim rights have been complied with. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Cts 2 and 3 in 22CF199. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Cts 2 - Battery and 3 - Disorderly conduct. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1. Sentence recommendations. 
Crt orders: S/W 3 years probation with conditions, (counts 2 and 3 concurrent).
Count 2: 
- Court costs $243.00, payable through Clerk of Court. Sept 1 to start date. 
- DNA Surcharge $200, payable through Clerk of Court with a Sept 1 start date. 
- Domestic violence surcharge $100
- DNA Sample
- Absolute sobriety 
- No Contact with C. Thompson except through text for child related matters only.  
- Participate in a domestic violence evaluation and complete follow through 
- Random testing 
- Complete and comply with AODA treatment plan

Count 3: S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- Court costs $243.00, payable through Clerk of Court. Sept 1 to start date. 
- DNA Surcharge $200, payable through Clerk of Court. Sept 1 to start date. 
- Domestic violence surcharge $100
- DNA Sample
- Absolute sobriety 
- No Contact with C. Thompson except through text for child related matters only. 
- Participate in a domestic violence evaluation and complete follow through 
- Random testing 
- Complete and comply with AODA treatment plan

Report to probation by noon today, August 2. Probation may be transferred to MN. 
3 days credit in the event of probation revocation
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Robert James Shane   DF:  Phillip Robert Desoto appeared. Case called at 3:18 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for an arraignment. Atty Shane has a copy of the information. Waives further reading. NG plea entered to all Counts. ADA Ellenwood has received a counter from Atty Shane offer but has not had time to respond. Court schedules. Address confirmed. Court adjourned at 3:21 p.m.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
Arraignment on June 15, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

* AMENDED *
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Crystal T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- May return to property with law enforcement to retrieve belongings


If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Robert James Shane   DF:  Phillip Robert Desoto appeared. Case called at 8:38 a.m. Atty Shane states DE will waive preliminary hearing. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. DE understands and waives preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court schedules for arraignment. Address confirmed. Atty Shane argues testing condition of bond. ADA Ellenwood does not take position. Court will amend bond.  Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Filed by ADA Ellenwood. arc    e; Atty Shane.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random alcohol random UA/ ETG testing at least 2 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Kaitlin Dippolito and Travis Satorius   DF:  Phillip Robert Desoto appeared from jail via video. DE has copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Does not qualify for PD services. Given PFAC. PD's office will assist for today. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Court finds good cause for exceeding time limits as request for counsel. Court will refund bond on file to payor.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:15 am.
